result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clairrease Mae Love

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:47 AM Defendant Clairrease Mae Love appeared by video.  Attorney Jaramy J Hansen in court for Clairrease Mae Love.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Defendant appears via zoom due to medical situation. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice. 
Defendant will come to Clerk or Court to sign a notice of hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:28 PM Defendant Clairrease Mae Love in court.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Clairrease Mae Love. Court notes hearing was set for status check. Defendant qualifies for public defender representation. Does not have an attorney assigned yet. Defendant would like to waive time limits for counsel to be appointed. Court accepts waiver as knowingly and voluntarily made. Preliminary hearing is rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

2:56 PM Defendant Clairrease Mae Love appeared by video in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. 
Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. 
Defendant does not wish to have the public defender make a special appearance with her today.
Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. 
Defendant wishes to plead no contest to charges; Court advises Defendant of Constitutional rights.  Defendant is unsure of how she wants to plead and wishes to speak with an attorney.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) on defendant's behalf. 
State requesting 500cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
nature of offense and prior ftas x 2, previously on probation x2 
Defendant has no response to States request; believes she can post the cash requested. Defendant notes that she does live in town now and can make it to her court appearances.
Court notes concerns about cash requested; Orders $500cb and $3000sb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Court questions defendant on intention to counsel; defendant indicates plans to apply PD.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
